name: Embassy Suites Tampa Airport/Westshore

reviews.text: Although the staff was pleasant and helpful, the rooms were rather old and need a good refurbishing. Tampa could use some better options close to the airport
reviews.title: Dated

reviews.text: I went to Tampa to have laser spine surgery.Staff treated me excellent and helped me anyway they could. They went above and beyond to cater to me and my needs. It is an excellent hotel to stay at especially if you are going down there to LSI. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in, even better than my bed at home, it really helped to have such a comfortable bed after having surgery. I was there for 8 days, 7 nights and it was comfortable and homey.
reviews.title: Excellent service-Comfortable beds-9out of 10 stars

reviews.text: My room was a king suite. It had a seperate room with sink, microwave, and refrigarator. I had a big living room with a balcony over-looking the pool which was nice. Seperate bedroom with a door and off of that was makeup area and bathroom.
reviews.title: The Heart of Tampa Bay

reviews.text: The room was extremely clean and just comfortable.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: In front of the hotel is a Waffle Shop and across the street is a big shopping mall with several restaruants that you can walk to. They were so nice at the hotel, even giving me a ride to Walgreens to pick up my prescriptions and taking me to my doctor appointment as well as to another mall to go eat at the Cheese Cake Factory. The shuttle drivers are very nice.
reviews.title: Not the best
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Very close to airport. Had a room on the 14th floor with a view of the bay. Went to the Outback Bowl. Hotel was less than five mins from the stadium. Staff very nice. Free cooked to order breakfast was excellent. Parking is only $7 per night. Very roomy with 2 room suites. Hot tub and and pool were nice. They do offer free airport shuttle to and from the airport.

I stayed at this hotel the people are very nice. The rooms are big and clean nice place to stay if you have a few kids with you they have room to run around. The staff was super nice and help me with all my needs. I didnt eat at the hotel but would of if I had time. I will stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We were happy overall with this hotel, especially for the low rate we obtained through Priceline. Parking was $7/night and they wanted like $12.95/day for access to internet in the room. We stayed for two nights and paid $52/night via Priceline.
reviews.title: Acceptable Accomodatios

reviews.text: The place was clean but the rooms were a bit weathered - poor workmanship in general but functionally it was just fine. There was cracked caulking and worn walls (example: corner edges were worn and wallpaper was peeling away in some areas). The room was HUGE - bigger than some apartments!
reviews.title: A Bit Surprised . . .

reviews.text: No complaints about the staff at all and the free breakfast was outstanding. We are not picky or demanding so we really don't have too much to complain about. The only comment that I will make is that the television when powered on was pre-set at too loud of a volume - not good when others in the suite are trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Decent business hotel but could use some freshening-up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is so out of character for me - as one might expect with a handle like Travel Skeptic I tend to provide less than stellar reviews for hotels that others often rave about. In this case, the Embassy Suites Tampa Airport was not only the cheapest but the nicest (in many ways) hotel that I stayed in during my 18 day swing through the South East.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Of My Trip

reviews.text: My wife and I drove in from Charleston SC where we'd stayed at the Harborview Inn which was pushing $450/night when valet parking and taxes were added. All of this for a hotel with a small room, two uncomfortable beds, and a tiny television (might have been 24"). See my review. After that, getting a suite with two big TV's, a nice shower, a cooked breakfast, and free airport shuttle for $118/night AAA rate was the deal of the year. I guess everything is relative.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We had a 6 PM flight the next day so we needed a reasonable place to stay. The Embassy Suites had a free business center so we could print our boarding passes and a major shopping mall across the street to kill time. It was also walking distance to our car rental place so we could ditch the car first thing in the morning to save some money, and had a free airport shuttle. These were the deciding factors.
reviews.title: Dated, but not bad

reviews.text: I rate my hotel rooms based on 3 things: A good bed, a hot shower, and a quiet setting. The Embassy Suites Tampa Airport scored 5/5 on all accounts. The cooked breakfast was great, the checkin and checkout were fast and efficient, and the two big TV's were great. The room was extremely quiet to the point that I didn't even notice the usual airplane takeoff / landing noises you generally get at an airport hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
embassy suites does not honor guaranteed reservation
reviews.text: OK - so the room was a bit dated, and there were two big ottomans in front of the sofa instead of a table as other reviewers have commented, but I'm not sure I see the big deal. As a general rule when I stay in an airport hotel I'm not there for the view, don't need a balcony, and don't care if the furniture has a few dents. I'm likely camping out for a night or two before or after a long flight and need a good night's sleep at a reasonable cost. This hotel provides just that.

Stayed here one night on a quick business trip to Tampa. Don't really know why a tourist would end up here, but if you have business in the Westshore area or laying over from the airport, location is good.
reviews.title: OK hotel---wish I could say same about showers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room layout was strange---walked into a miniscule "living" area, followed by an empty space next to the bathroom and then the bedroom. Embassy Suites touts its separate living room/bedroom set up but frankly, it's just a matter of putting up a walls. I've stayed in regular hotel rooms that were bigger than this room but just in one big space.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the area

reviews.text: Bed was comfortable, good a/c and cable selections, very clean. Absolutely nothing bad, but nothing that made it above average.
reviews.title: Nice staff, great night's sleep

reviews.text: Two drawbacks: the next morning, hot water wasn't working in the shower. Not fun. Also, the parking situation is a little strange. You park in a building adjacent to the hotel which, to the best of my knowledge, has no elevator. I trudged through 3 sets of stairs, carrying a bag in June Florida weather. Not comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice from the Outside - Fraying on the Inside

reviews.text: Nothing really horrible to say about this place, but I personally wouldn't stay there again. For a little more money, there are much better options in the area.
reviews.title: Perfect for Cruising from Tampa with a group or couple

aka: Embassy Suites Tampa Airport/Westshore Hotel Tampa
description: Located minutes from Tampa International Airport, Embassy Suites Tampa Airport Westshore provides warm hospitality for your business or leisure travel. Our 243 all-suite accommodations offer amenities designed for your comfort and convenience. Enjoy complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast daily and a complimentary Manager's reception nightly.
